I'm back looking at Heritrix and how I would implement an RPC decide
rule, =
but I need to rethink how to go about this.  I need Heritrix to
make an RPC=
 call, passing the HTML contents to the RPC server, and
based upon the resp=
onse, extracting the URI's or not.  

So perhaps what I need is a custom ex=
tractor, that inherits from any
of the other extractor types, but makes an =
RPC call before actually
doing an extraction.  If the RPC comes back true, =
then do the
extraction, if not then return null.

Anyone have any ideas?  I=
 simply want to decide if I want to use the
extracted URI's based on the co=
ntent of the HTML.

Thanks,
Kaleb
